content:
The nanny, Leanne, is a fascinating and enigmatic character, and her motivations are definitely open to interpretation.

Throughout the season, Leanne's actions and behavior are often contradictory, making it difficult to pinpoint her true intentions. On the surface, she appears to be a kind, caring, and devoted nanny who is genuinely invested in the well-being of the family, especially Jericho. She's warm, empathetic, and seems to have a special connection with the baby.

However, there are also moments where Leanne's behavior is unsettling, and you start to wonder if there's more to her than meets the eye. She's incredibly secretive, and her past is shrouded in mystery. Her obsessive attention to Jericho and her fixation on the family's dynamics can be seen as either a sign of devotion or something more sinister.

One interpretation is that Leanne is indeed trying to help the family, but her methods are unorthodox and perhaps even manipulative. She might be attempting to heal the family's emotional wounds and bring them closer together, but her approach is unconventional and sometimes creepy.

On the other hand, it's possible that Leanne has an ulterior motive, and her actions are driven by a hidden agenda. She might be using her position to exert control over the family, exploit their vulnerabilities, or even exact some kind of revenge.

The truth is, Leanne's motivations are intentionally ambiguous, and Shyamalan has said that he wants viewers to question her intentions and draw their own conclusions. Even the cast members have mentioned that they're not entirely sure what Leanne's true motivations are!

Ultimately, Leanne's character is a masterclass in subtlety, and her enigmatic nature is a big part of the show's appeal. You'll likely be guessing her true intentions until the very end, and even then, you might still be left with more questions than answers.
